singlestore.connection.Cursor¶

class singlestore.connection.Cursor(connection: singlestore.connection.Connection, cursor: Any, driver: singlestore.drivers.base.Driver)¶

Database cursor for submitting commands and queries.

This object should not be instantiated directly. The Connection.cursor method should be used.

__init__(connection: singlestore.connection.Connection, cursor: Any, driver: singlestore.drivers.base.Driver)¶

Call Connection.cursor instead.

Methods

__init__(connection, cursor, driver)

Call Connection.cursor instead.

callproc(name[, params])

Call a stored procedure.

close()

Close the cursor.

execute(oper[, params])

Execute a SQL statement.

executemany(oper[, param_seq])

Execute SQL code against multiple sets of parameters.

fetchall()

Fetch all rows in the result set.

fetchmany([size])

Fetch size rows from the result.

fetchone()

Fetch a single row from the result set.

is_connected()

Check if the cursor is connected.

next()

Return the next row from the result set for use in iterators.

nextset()

Skip to the next available result set.

scroll(value[, mode])

Scroll the cursor to the position in the result set.

setinputsizes(sizes)

Predefine memory areas for parameters.

setoutputsize(size[, column])

Set a column buffer size for fetches of large columns.

Attributes

connection

Return the connection that the cursor belongs to.

lastrowid

Return the rowid of the last modified row.

messages

List of received messages.

rowcount

Return the number of rows the last execute produced or affected.

rownumber

Current row of the cursor.

description

Description of columns in the last executed query.

arraysize

Default batch size of fetchmany calls.
